alert.note: Alert for Boone County Except Southwest; Boone County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations; Newton County Lower Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 12:38AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Newton and southern Boone Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1236 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Harrison to near Kingston. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Harrison... Jasper... Valley Springs... Olvey... Lost Valley State Park... Capps... Erbie... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Pruitt... Red Bank... Bellefonte... Wayton... Boxley... Mossville... Marble Falls... Compton... Low Gap... Crossroad... Parthenon... Gum Springs in Newton County... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
